alert.note: Alert for Duval (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 2:13PM CDT until August 15 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south Texas, including the following counties, Duval, Jim Wells, La Salle, Live Oak, McMullen and Webb. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Fortysix Creek, Canyon Creek, Resaca de Enmedio, Nopaleras Creek, San Andreas Creek, Charamusca Creek, Las Animas Creek, Hill Creek, Guajillo Creek, Cow Creek, Nueces River, Botello Creek, Ygnacio Creek, Toro Creek, Chiltipin Creek, Muerto Creek, Lattas Creek, Trinidad Creek, Juanita Creek, Devils Waterhole Creek, San Jose Creek, Leopard Creek, Little Cow Creek, Palo Amarillo Creek, Hoffman Creek, Kings Branch, Soledad Creek, Drummond Creek, Amargosa Creek, Piedras Pintas Creek, San Diego Creek, Government Wells Creek, Black Creek, Spur Creek, Rosita Creek, Mule Creek, Santa Gertrudis Creek, Tarancahuas Creek, Lagarto Creek and Caballo Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Diego, Freer, Seven Sisters and Rosita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
